constpool

Interface ConstantType

  • All Known Implementing Classes:
    AbstractReference, ClassInfo, DoubleInfo, FieldRefInfo, FloatInfo, IntegerInfo, InterfaceMethodRefInfo, LongInfo, MethodRefInfo, NameAndTypeInfo, StringInfo, UTF8Info

    public interface ConstantType
    An interface, used to tie together the Classes in the constpool package. It has four methods, all of which supply basic information. All subclasses should implement the static method public static int getLength(), as this is used in the Decompiler class very heavily, and nothing will work without it.

    • Method Summary

      Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      int getRequiredLength()
      Returns the required length of this entry into the ConstantPool.
      byte getTagNumber()
      This will return the unique byte used to indicate what type of entry this is.
      java.lang.String getType()
      Returns the type, usually just getClass().getName()
      java.lang.String getValueAsString(ConstantPool pool)
      This will parse values, usually deciphering bytes into data.

    • Method Detail

      • getType

        java.lang.String getType()
        Returns the type, usually just getClass().getName()

      • getRequiredLength

        int getRequiredLength()
        Returns the required length of this entry into the ConstantPool. Should always return the same as getLength() in subclasses.

      • getTagNumber

        byte getTagNumber()
        This will return the unique byte used to indicate what type of entry this is.

      • getValueAsString

        java.lang.String getValueAsString(ConstantPool pool)
        This will parse values, usually deciphering bytes into data. Most subclasses will assign the result to a variable automatically.
        Parameters:
        pool - the ConstantPool data is gotten from
